This river rises from a glacier, called, therefore, the thne Glacier, on the Furca, and runs westwards down the valley between the Bernese and Pennino Alps, but nearer the Bernese. At A, it turne suddenly to the north, round the base of the western extremity of the Ber- nese Alps, and soon forms the Lake of Genevn, Lacus Lemma, 55 miles long.
